title: Anatomy of the Shoulder and Hip Joints
headline: This free online course explores the anatomy of the multiaxial shoulder and hip joints and common problems they face.
description: This anatomy course covers the anatomy, mechanics and common health issues associated with the shoulder and hip joints. We explain how the muscles, ligaments and bones affect the movements and dysfunctions of these body parts. Whether you are a healthcare professional, fitness enthusiast, paramedic or want to learn more about these important joints, this course provides the medical knowledge required to maintain the health of hips and shoulders.
courseDescription:
Did you know that the shoulder is one of the most complex joints in the human body? This anatomy course explores the bones, muscles, tendons, ligaments and other structures that make up the shoulders and hip joints. We also explain the biomechanics of these joints, the various movements they allow and the factors contributing to their injury or disorder.

What are the joints of the hips and shoulder? This course covers specific topics like the anatomy of the shoulder and hip joints ro answer such questions. We also lay out the major joint disorders and describe their diagnosis, prevention and various treatment options used to keep hips and shoulders working properly. The course traces the relationship between these joints and other body parts to provide a deeper understanding of human anatomy.

Our explanatory videos help you to engage comfortably at your own pace. We provide access to labelled diagrams and interactive exercises to help you grasp complex concepts and apply what you learn. This course is helpful if you are a healthcare professional seeking to deepen your knowledge of the shoulder and hip joints. It also suits anyone studying or practising in fields related to anatomy, kinesiology, physical therapy, sports medicine or orthopaedics. Sign up to learn the anatomy of the shoulder and hip joint and pick up methods used to keep them healthy.
